Reviews.Title: “well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: davidForres
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated at the Ostbahnhof, one of Berlin's major raiway stations, but we certainly didn't hear any trains during our 6-night stay. The hotel offers good clean rooms and an excellent buffet breakfast was included in the price we paid. A real bonus was the free travel pass that enabled us to travel on all of the outstanding public transport system, even as far as Potsdam. Staff at reception were extremely friendly and fluent in English. One slight drawback was the sound of feet in a corridor overhead, presumably as guests made their way for an early breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - OK Price”
Reviews.Author: ChristerTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within Railway Station East (Ostbahnhof). The price was OK, and so was the standard. Plus: OK bed & bathroom, railway-, subway- & bus-tickets included. Minus: Had to pay extra for breakfast and WiFi-access; both were seriously over-priced. -- Instead, we took the train to Alexandersplatz, went for a stroll and a good breakfast at a restaurant. We got online using hot-spots found while out, shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport and the city”
Reviews.Author: RobertULondon
Reviews.Content: Flew in to Schoenefeld airport then train to Ostbahnhof. Very cheap way to get into city, and picked hotel for price. Hotel is in the shopping centre which is a bit odd but obviously useful for shopping. Room nice enough, good for a night, wouldn't want to stay for a week as area feels a bit claustrophobic. Living in a shopping centre must be bad for your health. Friendly staff though.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL AT OSTBAHNHOF STATION”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is built into the station Ostbahnhof station. I had a business room at second floor which was a very clean,quiet and nice room. Highly recommended in this area of Berln. Well worth it's 4-star grade!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: IndiaHunter
Reviews.Content: Excellent location ( Ostbanhoff station, right opposite the east side gallery). The hotel is neat and clean, and there are plenty of options for breakfast, just outside the hotel. WiFi internet is paid, but 9 Euros for 5 hour is not too bad, and the speed was excellent. Staff is very friendly and helps with lot of travel tips. Overall – a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SunseekerJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located as a transport hub to see Berlin and very easy to access from the airport. The free travel card is a bonus. The staff were trully amazing at giving us help to find our way around, ordering taxis in the rain as we were a large group. Friends enjoyed the hotel bar. The proximity to Ostbanhof amenities was a perfect with a food court that had very good food from sushi to pizza. We would definately stay here again. In 3 words comfortable, clean, accessible.

Reviews.Title: “So easy for everything”
Reviews.Author: sunseekerP
Reviews.Content: My wife found this hotel and decided to book us in one the strength of reviews, the cost and the fact the price included a City Public Transport Pass for the duration of our stay. The hotel could not have been easier to find as it is smack bang in the middle of the station complex at Osterbanhoff, with direct links to the airport, and all local transport, Overground, Underground, Buses and trams as well as a taxi rank and local shops. The Hotel is clean (very) the staff are friendly and very helpful, as our local knowledge was non-existant. If there is one downside it is that the building is not air-conditioned, but we knew that when we booked. We opted for the room only, breakfast was easy to organise as there is a food mart in the complex and the choice of breakfast was vast, coffee and Dunkin' doughnuts through sushi to curry wurst and beer, what ever your taste. We travelled in a party using 4 rooms at this hotel and between the 7 of us we had NO COMPLAINTS WHAT SO EVER. You can even use the Free travel pass to return to the airport. Top banana.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: megbremner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because this was the meeting place for a charter train trip I was taking with a German company. The location at the Ostbahnhof (East Berlin) was excellent and the hotel offers a free transport card for the length of one's stay. My room was clean and comfortable and affordable. One could access CNN and BBC on the TV. The Ostbahnhof offers several restaurants and other amenities. The restaurant in the hotel serves good food but is a litle over-priced in my opinion. I walked to Alexanderplatz from the hotel in about 20 minutes. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is not a 'charming European' hotel by any means but the convenience is worth a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it - great location”
Reviews.Author: Mon55
Reviews.Content: Located right at the Ostbahnhof making transport around Berlin easy. Friendly helpful staff - transport card for length of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReefyReef
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money at the discounted rate, with the S and U railcard included. Located right in the train station, you have access to fast food resurants and two Supermarkets located on the basement level. Beware only 2-3 of the TV channels were in English, the rest of the channel are in German.

Reviews.Title: “"LOCATION GREAT NOT MUCH CHARACTER TO THE PLACE"”
Reviews.Author: ramsayj01
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is in a great location and the staff were very nice. If you are looking for a bit of European flavour on your trip this is not the hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money - free rail card was icing on cake”
Reviews.Author: Ria16
Reviews.Content: Came on a city break for 3 nights and would absolutely recommend this hotel. Great value for money and ideally located next to the Ostbahnhof train station which worked well for sightseeing. Rooms were simple and clean and breakfast was great. All in all I'd definitely recommend the hotel, the staff were helpful and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Kathy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was near the airport which made it ideal for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: masih1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in December. The worst hotel staff, poor breakfast and services, but good location and fairly convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwmrtd
Reviews.Content: During a weekend in February I stayed here 2 nights. The hotel is inside the Ostbahnhof; there is no U-Bahn there, but the trains and S-Bahn run very regularly. Alexanderplatz is only a few minutes away and the Hakische Hofe also. The hotel is a good basic one; nothing particularly good or bad.

Reviews.Title: “I bit expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Sue29
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the Ostbahnhof so very good location for getting around the city and out of the city. It is a bit expensive but if you take into consideration that you get a good breakfast included, and free transportation on all the S bahns, U bahns and busses, it is worth it. You just go downstairs and the train station and the S Bahn is just down there. Also a mall with all kinds of restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid in summer!”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the InterCity a few times, and wrote a favorable review on TA in 2006. The hotel still has all the same plus points: handy location, spotless rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast and free travel passes. However as our previous stays had been during the winter months, we hadn't noticed the lack of air conditioning. It was 31C during our stay (which is not unusual for Berlin) and this left our room uncomfortably warm. The fact that many of the rooms face into a courtyard doesn't help ventilation. At any other time of the year this hotel would be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for tourists”
Reviews.Author: ClaireW2006
Reviews.Content: We (a couple in early 30s) visited Berlin for a weekend break and flew in with Ryanair on the Thursday night and out early Sunday morning from the aiport Schoenfeld. So the InterCity Hotel fitted perfectly our criteria of accomodation that was within easy and afforable reach of the airport as it's located in the Ostbahnhof station about 25 mins from the airport by train. The reception staff were very friendly as were the bar staff. We had worried that it may have been better to stay in Alexanderplatz but the hotel gives you a travel pass for your entire stay, which can be used on trams, trains and buses. The trains are so efficient, so there's no inconvenience from staying at this hotel and everywhere is within easy reach. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as we found a cheaper option was to get the train to Alexanderplatz and visit the Alex Cafe round the back of the TV Tower. There's a buffet breakfast for about six euros. We also ate out for dinner so can't comment on the food in the hotel. There's no problem with noise from the trains at all. However, our room was facing the front of the hotel above some bus stops. At one point, all we could hear were coach engines running and people talking as they hung around but was only a problem for the Saturday night. Overall, I'd say we found it the InterCity Hotel an ideal base for visiting Berlin's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkbpkb
Reviews.Content: We booked the Intercity hotel because we were spending the time looking for places to live in Berlin and therefore wanted to be near a hub of S-Bahn, U-Bahn, which the Ostbahnhof is. The room was pretty small, not helped by the fact that we had a baby cot in there as well. I called before arrival to check that a kettle would be in the room in order to be able to heat up the baby's bottle. They said there would be but we would have to upgrade to a business class room. At this point we should have just decided to take our own kettle with us, but anyway, we didn't think about that. Upon arrival we were told that the double bed we had reserved was now actually 2 twin beds pushed together. On the plus side, though, included in the room price (any room price, not just business rooms) were travel tickets for zones A,B,C for both of us for the duration of our stay. This was a saving of about €50 over the 4 days, so that was good. There are quite a few shops and food places in the station, but there is a shortage of restaurants to go to in the immediate vicinity of the station. We tried the restaurant in the hotel one evening - the food was quite good, but the restaurant was pretty deserted - plenty of other options around Berlin, I suppose.... I probably would stay there again, but only when travelling on business. The station is buzzy, and it is handy having supermarkets in the station basement.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mas2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located inside the Ostbahnhof in Berlin. The location is very convenient. You are also provided with a transportation card for the duration of your stay, which is also very nice (it's worth about 6 Euros per person). The rooms are decent. Nothing spectacular, but also nothing to complain about. I paid $100 Euros per night for a 2 bed room, which included breakfast. The breakfast was actually quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: LMExplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights last weekend while exploring the city of Berlin. Because the hotel is located above the Ostbanhof train station, it was super convenient to get anywhere. Plus, the hotel provided a transportation card good for use of any public transportation during our stay. We asked for a non-smoking quiet room when booking from the hotel website and ended up at the end of the 2nd floor in a large handicapped room facing the internal courtyard. It was quiet except at 9:00 each morning when the cleaning staff headed out to start their rounds banging carts and chatting in the hallways. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and fluent in English.

Reviews.Title: “Great, conveniently situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: ali2020
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it for short breaks, mainly due to its location - literally connected to Ostbahnhof station - which means its easy to get around the sprawling city. My room was clean and much like a generic chain hotel, modern furniture and decor, great bathroom with power shower, mini bar etc. Despite being on the back of the hotel overlooking the station platforms I was not disturbed by noise from the trains (although I didnt have the windows open). My room was very quiet. The staff here were very helpful and the travel card you get for staying is a bonus. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the longest remaining stretch of the wall along the river and through the station the other way there are plenty of food stalls and shops. The station itself contains plenty of cheap places to eat and drink so I didnt bother with the hotel breakfast. Great value and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: love-to-go-go
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 11/05 - very late in posting. I'm researching another trip now and wish I could find similar accommodations west of Germany! The Berlin InterCity is attached to the Berlin Ostbahnhof (in East Berlin). We made the mistake of walking around the outside of the station complex to find the hotel, but once we knew where it was - it was an EXCELLENT find. Our holiday special rate included a dinner for two as well as breakfast daily (we stayed 2 nights). The InterCity's provide a local transit pass free with your stay - can't begin to say how helpful that is. In a new country/city/etc.. we had no worries about purchasing transit. Took bus or rail EVERYWHERE - especially easy considering we were sleeping next to the station. Speaking of that, we could also hop next door to grab snacks, drinks, etc.. On our last day, we grabbed a lunch to go for our 4-hour train ride to Prague. The breakfast had a lot of selection, so it was decent. Dinner was OK - considering it was free. Our only choice was the special of the day - duck. It wasn't bad (don't have experience with duck) - it at least got us to try something new. The staff always seemed a little uninterested, but the whole concept of service is different in Europe that the US. The room was fair size for Europe, from review advice we requested a room on the quiet side of the hotel (non-station side) - we heard no train noise. (I'm not sure if we would have - the rooms seemed to be well soundproofed). We were traveling with a toddler, and the crib was sturdy and, although the crib wasn't there when we arrived it was delivered promptly. The beds were 2 twins pushed together, but we ended up with that all over Europe. The comforters were great though - down. The rooms were clean - especially the bathrooms. We don't often ask much of the front desk/staff, but they were very friendly and helpful when we did interact. All in all - we really loved the hotel. We stayed at 2 other InterCitys during our trip: Munich and Vienna. We won't stay anywhere else in Germany from now on and have recommended InterCity repeatedly.

Reviews.Title: “Such an amazing bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Samuel-D
Reviews.Content: I booked via Hotwire, and they didnt deceive me, I paid 38 euros per night which included a twin room plus daily travelcard for 2 people (worth 6 euros each) which means that the room was only 26 euros, and for that price, it was amazing value, very clean hotel and room, although the beds were very small. The situation is right inside the Ostbanhof, with links to everywhere in the city so easily, it has also a lot of nice shops, that were open at 6am on sunday such as Mcdo, library, kebbab, dunkin donuts... Would definitively recommend it if you get a good price, the mini bar was also well price (2.50 euros for a beer) although phone calls were very expensive (around 3 euros for 2 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to start your European vacation”
Reviews.Author: Navytowntravlr
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel by accident when we were unable to make our train to Prague and had to overnight in Berlin. This hotel is located right next to the Ostbahnoff train station in Berlin and is good if you are passing through or wish to stay in Berlin. For 100 euros per night (incl. Breakfast – rate in early OCT 2005), this hotel is a great deal for the value. This rate also includes a free pass on Berlin’s public transport system, which is good until midnight the day you check out. The double room we stayed in was very clean and of standard European size, almost equivalent to a US studio size hotel room. The rooms are also very quiet – you can hear police sirens when they go off but otherwise there is no need for earplugs. The room also has a mini-bar that is adequately stocked (beer prices are comparable to those in town but other items are slightly higher than the retail rate). The room has no AC but did have heat and a private bathroom with toilet, shower, hairdryer and soap. There is no alarm clock in the room. The staff is very courteous and everyone we encountered spoke English. Public internet is also available with the purchase of time cars at the front desk. Public parking is also available. Breakfast is well worth the price – not just your traditional continental breakfast but an assorted buffet with cured meats, eggs, fruit, yogurt, and juices (incl. sauerkraut juice, apparently an acquired taste). Out of all the places that we stayed on our European trip, this one had the best breakfast of all. The proximity to the train station is extremely helpful when you need personal items or services a traveler would need – post office, ATMs, food, refreshments, pharmacy, toiletries. If you plan a lot of train travel while you’re in Berlin, this hotel will serve as a great jump point.

Reviews.Title: “Earplugs are your only problem”
Reviews.Author: MsInformation
Reviews.Content: I went strictly on price with a "lastminute" deal. I'd read other reviews from fellow trip advisors and was confused by mention of the travel card. What a thrill to be given free public transport for the duration of my stay upon check-in. This is a feature for every single guest at a ICE hotel regardless of how you book. Every amenity is available because it's on top of the Ostbahnhof station/shopping mall. You don't get breakfast in the price and the restaurant is typically overpriced so the food court in the mall is perfect - there are 24hr IMBISS stands on the other side of the station too. This is on the route for suburban trains from Schoenefeld to the centre (2euros single trip) and 5 -10 minutes any time of day or night to the centre and all points of Berlin. Bus connections are easy too from the front of the station. This is a no frills very comfortable hotel. Contemporary furnishing means you can see that it's kept very clean and staff were all fluent in English for when too many trips to the bierkellars meant my rubbish German went down even further in standard. One note: You will need earplugs, on the station side of the hotel if you sleep with the windows open you will hear the train announcements (but not the trains - weirdly) and service vehicles to the shopping mall if you remember this vital piece of equipment you will have a very comfortable high value bargain basement stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Situation, Good Staff, Super Price”
Reviews.Author: tim_m
Reviews.Content: Actually on the East Railway Station in the centre of Berlin (no train noise however!), this hotel is superb value for money. We booked thanks to two earlier reviews on this site and can confirm that the positives are all deserved. If you are travelling independently it is three stops from the airport. and 2 minutes walk from the train. Staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are fine and the free travel card saves a fortune. I would recommend on all accounts without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value -highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking via a travel agent came up with the Inter City Hotel. Amazing value - not much more tham a superior hostel price for two. We saved so much money by using the free transport card in Berlin, Potsdam and to the airport. Very clean, comfortable and polite service. Fantastic position for getting a short hop train (FREE!) to all the major sights, and only a stone's throw from the East Side Gallery moving murals on the old Berlin Wall. Go!

HotelInfo.Name: InterCity Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Am Ostbahnhof 5, 10243 Berlin, Germany
